titles.title: English /r/ in German Learner English: Dataset for chapter 6 in "Phonological variation in German Learner English"

contributor.contributorName: The Tromsø Repository of Language and Linguistics
contributor.familyName: Tromsø Repository of Language and Linguistics

rightsList.rights:
This dataset, "English /r/ in German Learner English: Dataset for chapter 6 in "Phonological variation in German Learner English"", may be reused according to the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) license as described here: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/.

The data contained in the tabular file "r_data_pascoe.csv" has been extracted from tables and other parts of the following academic work:

Pascoe, Graham. 1987. Die Aussprache des Englischen an bayerischen Schulen. München: Profil.

and rearranged into the tabular form in the file "r_data_pascoe.csv".

Therefore, the data from Pascoe (1987) as reused in the file "r_data_pascoe.csv" represent facts and are reused under Public Domain conditions as described here: https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/pdm/.

The data contained in the tabular file "r_data_rank.csv" are based on data extracted from the following academic work:

Rank, Isabel. 2018. Realisation of post-vocalic /r/ by advanced German learners of English. Unpublished BA thesis, University of Bamberg, Germany.

These data are here reused according to the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) license as described here: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ with the permission from the author (see the file "data_consent_rank.pdf").

The data contained in the tabular file "r_data_wunder.csv" are based on data extracted from the following academic work:

Wunder, Christina. 2012. Final devoicing in German Learner English: A study at a Franconian grammar school. University of Bamberg, Germany MA thesis.

These data are here reused according to the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) license as described here: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ with the permission from the author (see the file "data_consent_wunder.pdf").

descriptions.description: This dataset contains auditory classifications for prevocalic and postvocalic /r/ produced by German learners of English. The data originate from four different studies. The data by Pascoe (1987) include n = 26 speakers (instructional-setting learners from southern Bavaria; age: 14-16 years), who produced a total of n = 346 prevocalic and n = 303 postvocalic tokens. These data were elicited with the re-telling of a picture story. The data by Wunder (2012) include n = 30 speakers (instructional-setting learners from northern Bavaria; age: 11-20), who produced a total of n = 778 prevocalic and n = 658 postvocalic tokens. These data were elicited with the reading passage. The data by Soenning (2020) include n = 62 speakers (instructional-setting learners from northern Bavaria; age: 11-30), who produced a total of n = 1037 prevocalic and n = 2933 postvocalic tokens. These data were elicited with two reading tasks, a word list and short question-answer sequences. The data by Rank (2018) include n = 21 speakers (mostly university students from Bavaria), who produced a total of n = 1933 postvocalic tokens. These data were elicited with a word list, a reading passage, and a casual conversation with the author of that study. See ReadMe file for more details. Related publication: Soenning, Lukas. 2020. Phonological variation in German Learner English. University of Bamberg dissertation. DOI: 10.20378/irb-49135 Open access: https://fis.uni-bamberg.de/handle/uniba/49135
